data.title: When is a great BBQ place a great Burger place?
data.text: When it's Golden Rule, that's when!  I love this place.  The BBQ is excellent.  You can watch them cooking the pork shoulder right there inside the restaurant, and there must be a hundred going at any one time!  These guys know how to 'que.  I order the sliced "outside", which gets me the beautiful bark with the burnt bits that carry all the flavor, along with some of the tender, juicy inside meat.  Ask for the sauce on the side so you can adjust the amount on the sandwich and get the fries...delicious.  But what if you're not in the mood for BBQ?  Order a burger!  They make these from fresh beef and hand form them before grilling them to perfection.  Add cheese and go "all the way" (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle) with may and mustard and you've got the best burger in B'ham.  So go, eat BBQ and Burgers...you will be happy!

data.title: Worst BBQ ever
data.text: Sauce was like catsup. Most of the menu was non-BBQ. I just don't understand how the door stays open

data.title: Great traditional Bar-B-Q
data.text: We have been coming to Golden Rule for years. GR has been around for decades. Its a small, cozy place but the people are very friendly.  If you're not in the mood for Q, but with someone who is, try the cheesburger or BLT. And the beer is always cold.

data.title: Birmingham is a BBQ town!
data.text: It is hard to even name all the great barbecue joints in our city, but Golden Rule is right up there as one of the oldest and the best! Visitors, make sure to stop here for a lunch or dinner. In fact, I have met several folks from out-of-town who came here on recommendations. Small, not fancy, but..... Oh, open the door and smell that BBQ right off! You can see the butts smoking. Fast service - order a SLICED sandwich ( yes, not chopped here!) with fries and be prepared to taste that delectable meat with absolutely NO fat! Just a little "crunchiness" on the ends. Save room for the pies!

data.title: Fried Peach Pie to die for
data.text:
I really think the fried peach pie (fresh out of the fryer) with ice cream is what's served in heaven. Unbelievable.

Made me totally forget the excellent barbecue that preceded it -- and that's saying a lot!

data.title: Best Bar b Que  off the grill on the plate!
data.text:
Once you order , the meat comes off the grill. I order outside sliced!
Sauce on the side! Always fantastic !

Who cares about the sides, the flavor is special.

data.title: BEST Golden Rule
data.text: There are several locations of Golden Rule, but for some reason this one is better than all the rest.  I love their BBQ.

data.title: Very Good Q and Great Service; Exceeded expectations.
data.text:
We sat at the counter on a very busy Saturday afternoon on a holiday weekend. Our server Karen was very attentive and should be commended for her true spirit to serve. Although we passed she suggested dessert and did well sincerely wishing us a great weekend. 

The BBQ was great and exceeded expectations. We watched the pitmaster tend the pork butt in the smoker telling us that it takes 6-8 hours cooking time. We enjoyed the BBQ sauce, I had the sliced and it was mixed with meat from the ends and the middle. My wife enjoys here pork chopped. The French fries were hot and tasty, the baked beans were awesome. 

We enjoyed our lunch and put this experience up there with the best in BBQ. We highly recommend and look forward to our return.

data.title: Wonderful food . Very nice staff
data.text: We visited June 26th 2016 . I got the sliced pork plate and wife got the chopped pork plate . We cleaned them both lol. Probably the best bbq we ever had . Not over smoked , just right . Great jobs guys . Omg. Don't leave without getting a fried apple pie or peach pie . Made from scratch . Wow

data.title: best food ever!
data.text: the BBque is great and the burgers are too the staff there is wonderful.  Please stop by and try them.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Spent the night in Birmingham and this place was right down street.  Only sliced and pulled pork but that is because they do this amazing!  We had both and it was great.  Baked beans were awesome as well.  Loved the vinegar sauce!  A must stop when you are in area.

data.title: Golden Rule BBQ Hoover - Great BBQ, but try the fried pies!
data.text: The BBQ is fantastic - Don, the pit master really knows what he is doing.  The wait staff (especially Lisa!) are amazing and the fried pies are just like Grandma used to make.  It doesn't get any better than this!

data.title: Doesn't get any better than this.
data.text: Stopped in on our way headed south and simply loved the experience.  Our waitress was super friendly and said that if we only eat here once to split a burger and the pulled pork sandwich.   Both were some of the best that we had.  Will definitely stop on our way through next time.  Many years of amazing food will keep us coming back.

data.title: Downhome taste in the midst of the hustle and bustle
data.text: Along Hwy 31 there is tension that often accompanies traffic congestion.  But come through these doors and you are instantly in a family restaurant that has the normal BarBQ options.  Clean, friendly and good food, it's a great escape.

data.title: Just as I remembered from 20+ yrs ago
data.text: In this case, that's a good thing. This BBQ has been consistent since I have eaten it over the years. I have also had their catering at events, and would highly recommend. Fries are average, but it's not a fry-joint.

data.title: My Humble Opinion - Best Hamburger in Hoover, AL
data.text: I always order the big beef burger and it's always delicious. In fact everyone in our family of 6 orders either the small or large hamburgers with fries and tea. Must be the grease from the decades old grill that makes the burgers so good. BBQ is ok too. Atmosphere is not so great, limited seating and crowded at lunch. Service though is pretty fast considering burgers are cooked to order.

data.title: Where can you go and say you've eaten there for 26 years
data.text: As I entered tonight and was greeted by name from both cooks and most of the staff, It becomes apparent I like this place. I've literally eaten Twana's hamburger steak since before I was even married and the grill master has always cut me a little piece of bark off a butt  cause he knows I like that. You MUST have a beefburger  or hamburger steak from here! Make sure to stop if you get close.

data.title: Best Pork In Birmingham!
data.text: The menu is limited, the building is old, the dining area is small, and I love this place.  Never had a bad meal!  This place is not for everyone.  This is BBQ comfort food.  Nothing healthy on the menu.  Very good!

data.title: Port in a Storm
data.text: After driving thru tornado warnings and rain, this was a welcome stop.  We had BBQ, burger, BLT, chili.  Chili was the best I ever had.

data.title: Takes me back!!
data.text:
Golden Rule is a BBQ joint that's simple, straightforward, and reminiscent of the places we used to eat at before the "foodie" culture expected that our eateries also be trendy and hip. (A BBQ place where I live now actually has tofu BBQ on the menu and that's blasphemous!)

I grew up in B'ham and used to wear out Golden Rule in high school. I live 6 hours north now in a BBQ desert and on a recent trip home I just had to have some GR and I'm glad I did. 

It's still the same. Busy, as always but with good, speedy, and friendly Southern service. My mother's hamburger was huge and said to be really good and my pulled pork and fries were good and hit the spot. The sauce is good with a touch of tang and the meat had a nice smokey flavor. We were served quickly and enjoyed our lunch. It was also inexpensive. 

If you want good and simple BBQ from an old school Southern BBQ joint, then GR is worth a try.
